shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 1vb-99rb) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 1vb-5rb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 6ra-11ra) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 6ra-8rb) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 8rb-11ra) I-3) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 56 miracles (fols. 11ra-99rb).

donors.donor:
The original donor is most probably Rǝstä (?) Maryam (s. fol. 34vb) initially mentioned in supplication formulas. His wife Wälättä Krǝstos (e.g., fol. 17rb), his daughter Wälättä Dǝngǝl (e.g., fol. 15vb) as well as ʿAqbä Krǝstos with his wife ʿƎṣä Ḥǝywät (e.g, fol. 18ra) are also mentioned. However, their names were mostly erased and replaced with that of Zǝkrä Maryam (fol. 6ra) or Wälättä Mikaʾel and Wälättä Ṣǝyon (fol. 19vb).
Śärḍä Dǝngǝl, Wälättä ʾƎleni and Gǝddä Maryam are mentioned in the supplication formulas in Text I-1 (fols. 1vb, 5ra).

dcomments.dcomment: 19th century (?); quire I of somewhat later age.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was rebound. Many leaves are worn, stained with dirt. A few holes and tears were amended on fols. 7, 19, 20, 25, 37, 83. Fols. 7 and 13 are of smaller size.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (probably re-used) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; dark brown tooled leather inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, dice, "Maltese" cross).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Endbands are laced with a cord. Quire I is reinforced with a parchment guard.

inks.ink: Black, red (strong scarlet, fols. 1vb-5rb and vivid red, fols. 6ra-99rb).

squires.squire:
<I(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 1r-5v)> – II(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fol. 6r-14v) – III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 23r-30v) – ፬V(11; s.l.: 4, stub after 8/fols. 31r-41v) – ፭VI(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 42r-50v) – VII(6/fols. 51r-56v) – VIII(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 57r-63v) – IX(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 64r-70v) – X(6/fols. 71r-76v) – XI(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 85r-92v) – XIII(8; s.l.: 5, stub after 2; 8, stub before 1/fols. 93r-100v).
Quire I is of different size, probably added later.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: poor, crude. Hand b: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1vb-5rb (quire I): broadly spaced, uneven, angular letters. Hand b: fols. 6ra-99rb (quires II-XIII): irregularly spaced and slanted letters, distinct hook vowel markers (e.g. ት ቅ እ ው).

rubrications.rubrication: Hand a (executed in vivid red): nomina sacra and name of original donors (mostly erased); a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-2; incipit of sections and subsections. Hand b (executed in strong scarlet): nomina sacra and name of the donors; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; word ʾǝsäggǝd "I worship". Elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ኢየ፡ for ኢየሱስ፡ (e.g., fol. 36ra) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 51ra) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 8ra, 11ra, 19vb, 33rb, 65rb, 71ra) ለዓለ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 10ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 13va) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 12rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles are numbered. Most of the numbers of the sections of Text I-3 were written in the main hand. The scribe numbered sections of Text I-2, and gave the first miracle number 4. Number 42 does not appear; the scribe stopped numeration with 45 (41st miracle) and resumed with number 53 until 59 (i.e. 50th-56th miracle). However, the 42th-49th miracle are given numbers 45(!)-52 written in a secondary hand in pen.

extras.extra: - The names of the original donors, mentioned throughout the Ms., have been erased and on fols. 6r-27vb replaced with other names, written in a secondary hand. - The title of the work is written in pen on the inner side of the front board. - Corrections are written interlineally: e.g., fols. 31rb, 66ra, 67ra. - A few erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 23vb, 42vb. - Scribbles and drawings by recent hands, in pen and pencil: e.g., fols. 49v, 59r, 61v, 62r, 90r, 91r, 94r. - Unreadable stamp (of the church?): fols. 7r, 99r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks for quires IV-VI are written in the upper margin, fols. 23r: ፫, 31r: ፬, 42r: ፭.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Notes in the upper margin indicating the readings for church feasts and other occasions, in a secondary hand in pencil: ልደቱ: fol. 14ra ደብረ፡ ታቦር: fol. 27ra በሐዋርያት: fol. 51ra ስቅለት. fol. 89ra.

frames.frame: Fols. 1vb, 3v, 5v: coloured (red, black), crude ornamental bands; geometric motifs, nine dot asterisks.
